title: X Factor: Celebrity was thrown into chaos as BATS disrupted filming at Simon Cowell's LA villa
text:
X Factor: Celebrity was thrown into chaos after bats disrupted filming.

The new singing show, which kicks off on Saturday night, was filmed over the summer, but Louis Walsh has revealed it wasn't plain sailing.

A colony of the winged mammals targeted the judges and celebrity contestants at Simon Cowell's luxury LA mansion, with Louis Walsh blaming former judge Sharon Osbourne, according to the Daily Star.

Drama: X Factor: Celebrity, which was filmed over the Summer, was thrown into chaos after bats disrupted filming

Famous faces including Megan McKenna, Brendan Cole, Ricki Lake and Love Island's Eyal Booker and Wes Nelson descended upon the music mogul's luxury abode to audition for him and fellow judges Louis and Nicole Scherzinger.

The group were also joined by a host of music VIPs including record producers and executives.

However, reports suggest that things got off to a shaky start as bats swooped down over the guests, forcing producers to halt filming.

But Louis pointed the finger of blame firmly at his pal Sharon, who resides nearby with husband Ozzy Osbourne.

Terrifying: A colony of the winged mammals targeted the judges and celebrity contestants at Simon Cowell's luxury LA mansion, according Daily Star

Louis told the publication: 'Mrs O lives nearby so we were all joking she got Ozzy to send the bats over to disrupt the show.

'We ended up filming late into the night because of them. The joke was that it was all Sharon and Ozzy’s doing.'

He went on to suggest that because she wan't on the panel anymore, she got her rocker husband to send the bats over to 'disrupt the show'.

Meanwhile, former popstar Sinitta, who was also present during the audience, revealed she feared the flying beasts would take off with Simon's beloved dogs.

Shock: Famous faces including the stars of Love Island descended upon the music mogul's luxury abode to audition for him and fellow judges Louis and Nicole Scherzinger

Causing trouble? But Louis pointed the finger of blame firmly at his pal Sharon, who resides nearby with husband Ozzy Osbourne

She said: 'They must have been Ozzy’s bats! They were swooping down like seagulls. I was worried they might take Simon’s dogs Squiddly and Diddly off in their beaks.'

MailOnline have contacted representatives of the X Factor for comment.

Meanwhile, Simon recently revealed exactly why he decided to revamp the much-loved show to do a celebrity version.

'It just felt so obvious to do a celebrity version', he explained. 'The only condition was I couldn’t know who was going to be on it.

'I said to the team, “You’ve got to find some acts who you believe can sell records off the back of this, because if you don’t do that it won’t work.”

Uh oh: Reports suggest that things at the auditions got off to a shaky start as bats swooped down over the guests at Simon's home, forcing producers to halt filming

'So that was the deal and we stuck to it. I swear to God I didn’t have a clue who any of the acts were. I did walk away thinking, “If we’re smart, we have artists here who could actually sell records off the back of this”. So I thought that was fun and very exciting for the show.'

The music boss also shared how he felt about holding the auditions in his own back garden.

He said: 'When we filmed it that night it didn’t feel like work. I loved every second of it. I said to the producers, “If this really doesn’t work, we will have to re-audition for the show. That’s the deal.”

'So the fact that I felt we didn’t need to was just great. I found it interesting and fun, and doing this version of the show has also given me the chance to do All Stars. I’ve wanted to make the best of the best version of The X Factor for a long, long time. It’s been brilliant. I’ve loved every minute.'

X Factor: Celebrity starts Saturday at 8.40pm on ITV.
